definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost

sentences.english: This bird employs its beak as a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 用鳥喙啄了幾下就讓這條蛇一命嗚呼了。

sentences.english: If it had hit them, they could have all been killed.
sentences.chinese: 如果當時真打中他們，他們可能全都一命嗚呼。

sentences.english: A bullet through the heart ended her.
sentences.chinese: 一粒子彈穿心過肺，使她一命嗚呼。

sentences.english: He died of a broken neck.
It was enough to give a cheer last month when he rasped his last sour breath.
sentences.chinese: 就那次足以讓我爲他上個月的一命嗚呼歡呼了。

sentences.english: A bumble-bee stung one then there were five.
sentences.chinese: 飛來一蜇命嗚呼，六個只剩五。

sentences.english: Several years later, Zhang Kan alas a disease, leaving a hard to make ends meet youngest.
sentences.chinese: 過了幾年，張堪一病嗚呼，丟下一家老小艱辛度日。

sentences.english: Some evening night returns, rance encounters a serious traffic accident, result die.
sentences.chinese: 某晚夜歸，蘭斯遭遇一場嚴重車禍，結果一命嗚呼。

sentences.english: Now i am even more tense .
sentences.chinese: 嗚呼，現在比下單前更緊張了。

definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
(literary) (final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 呢[ne5] or 啊[a1])
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
(of a country) to perish/to be annexed/subjugation (to a foreign power)
